pull_request.title: doxygen update
pull_request.body:
Fixes #1226 

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Link documentation and code
pull_request.body:
Reference to a Wiki file does not link code and documentation suitably: For example #1221 changes the behaviour of configuration variables without the ability to document it before merge.

This PR therefore moves https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Customizing-liboqs into a file (to be amended in any PR changing the configuration logic). After merge the current [Wiki page about configuration](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Customizing-liboqs) shall point to this new file (CONFIGURATION.md). Additional benefit: The doxygen-generated documentation then also contains configuration option documentation in line with the code, so any distribution will contain documentation in line with its behaviour.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

pull_request.title: Integrates pqcrystals with common-aes / extends common code AES CTR-API
pull_request.body:
- Integrates pqcrystals (ref and avx2) with liboqs common AES code (for Kyber-90s and Dilithium-AES).
- Extends libOQS AES-CTR with Incremental API: `OQS_AES256_CTR_inc_init`, `OQS_AES256_CTR_inc_iv`, `OQS_AES256_CTR_inc_ivu64`, `OQS_AES256_CTR_inc_stream_iv`, `OQS_AES256_CTR_inc_stream_blks`.
- Adds some AES-CTR shim API.
- Faster AESNI CTR code (improved iv handling, 4x interleaved blocks for higher throughput).
- OpenSSL AES supporting CTR API.
- Updated pqcrystals patches (API, context releases).
- Removes redundant AES implementations from Kyber and Dilithium.
- Copy-from-upstream with updated patches.
- Uses internal AES on x86_64 (dist & AES) because of increased performance with the internal AESNI code.
- Adds AES-CTR benchmarks to speed_common

Fixes #973 

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->
